name: The Ritz-Carlton, Naples

reviews.text: We stayed here for our honeymoon in June. This hotel was very nice, wonderful decor and room design. Beautiful view from our balcony of the gulf. They brought us free choc. covered strawberries since it was our honeymoon. The food in the hotel dining establishments was very good, exept it is very expensive, plan to spend a lot if you eat at the hotel. Do not order the chocolate cake from the room service menu, it tasted like frozen Sara Lee cake. For all room service orders they add like $5 and 18% tip. Everyone there expects a tip, so be prepared for this. I forgot my pool supplies and a foam "noodle" was $8 at the pool shop compared to $1 at WalMart. The only really bad thing that happened was at the end of our stay we called the Concierege to call a taxi for just us (2) to go to the Naples Airport the next morning. We get down there and they called a 12 passenger van just for us that was $85, then proceeded to take us to Ft. Myers airport. $85 is crazy for a 5 min. taxi ride. So beware when it comes to money but other than that we had a wonderful time. Very nice hotel. Would come back, when richer
reviews.title: Very nice, but..

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay and found the hotel to be superior in terms of location and service. The rooms and all public areas were neat and clean. We had a few minor glitches, like being accidentally charged for a poolside lunch that we did not order, but the hotel staff was excellent at correcting any shortcomings and very pleasant in every way. We especially liked the towels and services at the pool and beach. The beach area, by the way, was kept spotless! Our only concern was that the restaurant prices, even for the more casual venues, were relatively high. We found ourselves, as well as our fellow guests, dining off premises frequently.
reviews.title: Great Location! Great Service!

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz Carlton, Naples June 9-13. Our stay was wonderful. Even though we had to deal with the effects of tropical storm Alberto the hotel staff more than made up for the bad weather. We had reserved a beach cabana for each of the days we were there but because of the weather were never charged. Never had to say a word about this.
reviews.title: Perfection!

reviews.text: We had several inquiries from the staff regarding our stay. One was a notecard given at turn down service, then a personal phone call from one of the managers to make sure we were having a good time. Unbelievable! We've stayed at other Ritz Carlton properties (Manalapan, Battery Park, Maui, and Cleveland) and have never experienced the service that the Naples establishment provided. When we had our privacy sign on our door during turn-down service...there hanging on our door were our chocolates--this happened twice! Little touches like this made our stay so special.
reviews.title: Loved this Ritz

reviews.text: We ordered room service one night around 10:00 and only waited about 15 minutes at the most for our order. Service with a warm smile everywhere we went!!!
reviews.title: very nice!
Beautiful Resort But Unnecessary Nickel-and-Diming
reviews.text: Having had several pleasant stays here over the past decade, I was disappointed to find a lack of sensitivity to customer relations, particularly in this economy when luxury hotels should be glad of the business. My group of six friends visited for a tennis and sun getaway and had a nice time overall. However, when one is paying over $500 per night per room, it is annoying to be nickeled and dimed for things that cost the hotel nothing.

reviews.title: ritz carlton at its very finest
reviews.text: First: trouble with late checkout. We had scheduled tennis lessons with the hotel's pros from ten o'clock to noon on two consecutive days, including our checkout day. Because the standard checkout time is noon and we had hoped to spend some of the afternoon by the pool and then shower, change and get ready for our evening flight, as soon as we arrived at the hotel, we asked for a late checkout of 4 p.m. (which I have never had a problem getting at other Ritz hotels). We were told that a 4 p.m. checkout would incur a charge for an extra night. We then asked if we could have a 2 p.m. checkout instead, and the response was that we would be charged for an additional half-day for the privilege of having the room for two hours beyond the noon checkout. All the hotel would agree to was a one-hour extension of our checkout time, until 1 p.m. Later one of our group returned and spoke to the manager, who conceded to a late checkout of 2 p.m. She was told that the hotel would be nearly filled with incoming guests on Sunday. As it turned out, when we left the hotel at 5:30 p.m. on Sunday, the entire place was empty. Why, then, was the hotel to so rigid in refusing to allow us a 4 p.m. checkout?

reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, great service.
reviews.text: Our second complaint was the shower fee. The hotel's gym is on the ground floor of the spa building. The only showers in the building are on the spa level, inside an area containing a locker room as well as a whirlpool, sauna, steam room and lounge. Because we would be leaving the hotel late Sunday afternoon and the late checkout had become difficult, we concluded that we could shower in the spa building (since we would no longer have our rooms) after spending some time by the pool. However, we learned that the hotel policy is that the spa showers and locker room may only be used by guests who purchase a spa service; those who do not purchase a spa service must pay $35 per person to use the showers. This struck us as ridiculous. (By the way, we had spent nearly $400 per day on hotel tennis fees.) Luckily, our group member who managed to get us an extra hour for late checkout was able to get "day passes" from management permitting us to use the spa showers -- one pass issued to each of the three hotel rooms, entitling two guests per room to use the showers. Did this go smoothly? NO. When we arrived at the spa, the spa receptionist said that each pass was only good for ONE person, not two. After some polite argument, we were able to convince her that the three passes had been intended to cover all six of us. We took our showers, but the experience was unpleasant and stressful, for no good reason.

reviews.title: Excellent, Top Notch Hotel
reviews.text: Finally, the restricted pool area. One-third of the poolside area around the "quiet pool" (adults only) is a cabana area available only to guests who pay the $495 daily cabana fee. The daily cabana fee includes lunch for four, massages for two, beverages, and some other services. The cabanas are set back on a raised terrace; down on the lower deck area along the pool's edge are about a dozen of the same sun lounges that surround the rest of the pool. When we got to the pool at about 2 p.m., all of the chairs were taken, except for those in the cabana area, which was completely deserted. We asked the pool manager whether we could just sit on the sun lounges as no other chairs were available. Of course, the answer was "no", though no one at all was using the cabana area -- it just remained empty. They did eventually bring some chairs from another area and jam them into a corner next to the building, so at least we had a place to sit. There was no effort to make us feel welcome, or try to work out a solution that made us glad to be spending money with them.

reviews.title: Great experience!
reviews.text: While it is true that each of these complaints is small in itself, when added together, they made us feel that the level of customer service was not what it should be. In an economy when many are thinking more carefully about where to spend their vacation dollars, this Ritz should be more attuned to its customers and how they feel they are being treated. All we want is to be appreciated as guests. Are you listening, Ritz Naples?

reviews.title: Great Stay with Little Kids
reviews.text: We came for Mother's day, and requested 2 adjoining rooms. Our rooms, although not ocean front had a nice view of the ocean. The staff were great, and very friendly with our kids. The food in the restaurants was fine for us, but the small children's menu felt limited for the number of days we were there, and we struggled toward the end to find meals that our kids would enjoy. The room cleanliness was a bit of an issue for us, and we had to call twice to have our rooms cleaned upon arrival.

reviews.title: outstanding
reviews.text: The beach was wonderful and the kids had a blast. It was helpful that it was not too wavy, and that the water was pretty shallow and very warm. I was dissapointed with the beach chairs, which felt like Holiday Inn (I have never stayed but that's what I imagine!) cheap plastic white chairs.

reviews.title: Beware of the wireless internet service!
reviews.text: My few irks: I would not expect that staying at the Ritz, I would have to pay extra for a beach umbrella every day ($25 per umbrella), nor that if I was offered a speacial at lunchtime, the price which was withheld would be 4x that of any other item on the menu (the crab claw portion was over $80 for lunch); or that if someone would ask if we would like juice poured for the table, they would charge for each glass including the kids. I don't mind paying, but the style in which it was done was offputting.

reviews.title: 5 Stars In Every Way
reviews.text: the ritz in naples was an outstanding hotel. the location was fantastic, beautiful beach, wonderful grounds. the staff is always ready to meet your needs and so friendly to my two young kids, my kids loved the pool and the kids club they had, the spa was also wonderful, all the restaurants we tried we great, i dont have a bad word to say about staying here!

reviews.title: Ritz Fits.
reviews.text: I thought the hotel was quite lovely, facilities and service were first rate and the beach had more seashells to collect than about any other beach I have ever visited. I used the wireless internet service at the hotel and was billed $9.95 per night. Everything was great until I discovered that all my online business was hacked! What a hassle closing accounts, changing usernames and passwords. I am 100% confident my problems began during my stay. I wrote the hotel to express my concern over a month ago with no response. Beware!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I came here last week and read the reviews about how the service here was terrible and that they were disappointed with the Ritz....I think they must be crazy.
reviews.title: IGNORE THE NAYSAYERS!!!! THIS IS AN AMAZING HOTEL!!

likes.disliked: — Wish they had more items on the dinner menu at The Terrace

reviews.text: I was contacted about a week before my arrival by Colleen asking if there was anything she could arrange for me. I mentioned that we would be honeymooning and had booked the "Reconnect" package.
reviews.title: Old World style in a New World destination

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival, valet was VERY busy, but we were instantly greeted and directed where to check in. Front desk member Luis was very gracious ( "How may I help you?, It has been my pleasure to assist you" ) and quickly checked us in and directed us to our room.
reviews.title: Not pleased with my experience

reviews.text: Stunning is all I can say about the room (#924) with an upgraded Gulf View and a chilled bottle of champange with a note of congradulations on our wedding from Guest Relations.
reviews.title: Off- Season -- Off Service

reviews.text: The room is much bigger than the pictures on the Ritz website..the view is amazing and the bed...to die for!
reviews.title: Service in Naples not up to Ritz standards

reviews.text: We were planning to stay for three nights but we checked out early and went to the Ritz Carlton Golf Resort instead. The difference was night and day!
reviews.title: Service was terrible!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We drove up and sat in our car, waiting for a valet or a bellman to acknowledge our arrival, nobody came while we sat there in silence, so I ended up having to get out and start unloading bags myself. It was only then a bellmen finally came to assist.
reviews.title: Ritz Carlton kill joy

reviews.text: After checking in at the desk, I looked for the luggage cart to get my computer - I asked the person at the bell desk who simply pointed off in the general direction I should go to find my luggage. I finally found the luggage cart unattended and sitting outside in direct sunlight, we had a small bag there with chocolate that was melting away as a result.
reviews.title: Awesome Vacation

reviews.text: After arriving to our room, we waited at least 25 minutes for our luggage to arrive, and after hanging our clothes - we found water dripping from the closet ceiling. Generator noises were coming from above the room at irregular intervals.
reviews.title: Three Night Stay at the Ritz

reviews.text: Staff seemed indifferent to our complaints, and twice the privacy sign on our door was completely ignored.
reviews.title: Just Awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The perfect stay. We were at the hotel for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon. The service was perfect, the room was great and overall it was the best experience I've ever had at a hotel. We had a direct Gulf view room on the 9th floor. Plenty of space, very clean and just lovely. Don't miss sunset at Gumbo Limbo. Although the drinks are pricey ($12.95 to $14.95) the atmosphere makes it worthwhile. I've never done a Spa day before but it was a great way to spend a morning.
reviews.title: Amazing - great service - great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the fourth time we have stayed at this Ritz and it was perfect once again. The staff is always friendly, pleasant, and accommodating. The hotel is always spotless and beautiful.
reviews.title: Always Exceptional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The people who work there, especially on the Concierge level are professional, yet not stuffy, and are constantly trying to do things to make your stay more pleasant. We feel so totally spoiled at the Ritz it is hard to leave and come back to the real world.
reviews.title: No disappointments: Ritz Carlton Tiburon

likes.liked: — Cleanliness, marvelous sheets, separate shower, marble bath, double sinks

reviews.text: It would be near impossible to pick put any one person who deserves special recognition when they all do such a wonderful job! (But Jane in the Club does deserve it!)
reviews.title: Another excellent vacation at the Ritz

likes.disliked: — The pool could have been bigger

reviews.text: If there is one thing I would say they can improve – it would be their mattresses. We were at the Biltmore Hotel prior to driving over to the Ritz – and trust me this is the only area where the Biltmore is superior compared to the Ritz. The mattresses at the Biltmore are the best I have ever slept on.
reviews.title: Oh so Beautiful
A Little Peace of Heaven
reviews.text: My girlfirend and I just got back from a perfect, weekend, HINT: Use the deck by the Spa Pool. Secret Hidden - NO CHILDREN!!!
Club Level was great!
reviews.title: First timer
Don't get your hair done here!
reviews.text: This was my first Ritz stay. Have stayed at 5 star before. Location on beach was lovely. Not impressed with the rest. Check-in was disorganized. Room not ready at 4:30pm. We were given a restaurant style pager and told to wait in the lobby. My husband had left work (he is a surgeon) to escape the pager scene. Found this tacky. No one in lounge to offer us tea (and the other strays waiting for their room). Once in room, found bedding nice, room quiet, enjoyed a good night's sleep. House keeping fine. I felt this hotel had a "luxury feel for the masses" atmosphere. I prefer smaller and intimate. Maybe if I had paid less I wouldn't be so negative, but at $450 per night I felt I could have spent it more wisely. The final straw was a line-up to go to the Terrace restaurant for breakfast. At these prices, there should be no line. This restaurant looked like a deluxe Denny's. On a postive note, the pools were lovely.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are very experienced travellers and we found this hotel to be very enjoyable unlike many of the previous negative reviews. It is amazing how people have different prospectives. Nonetheless, the beach and all its glory was one of the main highlights of our stay. We purposely did not dine at this hotel. We will return and stay again.
reviews.title: Relaxing and the beach was fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ritz on the beach for a very long weekend last week (29th-2nd) We were lucky in the sense that we were able to book on their 'sun and fun' package. When we arrived, they quickly upgraded our room to a beautiful full coastal view on the 9th floor. The room was just beautiful. Very comfy bed, great service and anything we needed. I can't rave enough about the service, the impeccable grounds and most of all, the reason we went, the spa. I see why this spa is rated in the top 15 in the US. I was fortunate because the day I spent there, I was alone, literally. The steam room had to be the best I've been in. The mineral pool upstairs is really relaxing. It's all superior. We found the food to be great. Had room service for breakfast and tried the buffet downstairs on Sunday-wonderful. Dinner at Gumbo Limbo was very good. Maybe a bit pricey but you're at the Ritz. Do you really want to leave this place to go to IHOP?
reviews.title: Relaxation plus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love this hotel and will return next year. Look for this special as it is $199 per night w/ a credit of $100 upon check out. There is a window of a couple of weeks around this time of year when it is offered. Our room is usually $900 in season! We had the best time!!
reviews.title: Superb service

likes.disliked: — Room could be a bit larger

reviews.title: Pampering Plus
reviews.text: We spent Saturday - Monday of Labor Day weekend (9/2 - 9/4) at the hotel. This was our first time staying at a Ritz property and we were thoroughly impressed. I was a bit nervous after reading some of the negative recent reviews, but I was relieved when we were welcomed with such wonderful service. Every employee we encountered made eye contact and greeted us. The concierges gave terrific recommendations for dining. The spa was great, although pricy. Next time, I would think about skipping the spa treatment and pay the $35 to spend the day using the spa facilities. Overall, we had a fabulous time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ritz Carleton (Beachfront) for 4 nights in mid-September to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. We are used to staying in very fine hotels both for pleasure and business. The hotel was just lovely. The room was spacious and very comfortable, with great amenities. Though we had the "coastal view", not direct oceanview, we were able to sit on our balcony and see a very large stretch of beach/gulf and sunset. If you book coastal view, I recommend a high floor. We were on 8 (out of 14). The staff was very accomodating and all hotel employees from housekeeping, to valet staff, to the concierge were very polite and helpful. Within a day they were calling us by name. The grounds are beautiful and the food, though not surprisingly priced high, was quite good. The beach was quiet and clean, though we did have some incidence with "red tide".
reviews.title: Disappointed in Service and Rooms

reviews.text: After reading all the great reviews on the Ritz Naples, I had high expectations and when I actually got there, I was disappointed. Yes, the beach is nice, no question about that, but these are the 2 things that disappointed me:
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. The hotel is old and has not been updated. The bathrooms for example do not have a separate shower, only a bathtub, they only have one sink (no-dual sinks) and just overall there are old (the toilet had a plastic part that was missing and looked really old, the bathroom wasn't all marble, was small...etc). The elevators are very slow/old and the pools just look dirty and old as well. There are doing some construction/renovation work right now but that only includes changing the glass doors for the balconies as far as the rooms go; in my opinion, they need to completely redo at least the bathrooms. I went to see the Ritz Golf Resort in Naples which is a much newer property and you could definitely see the difference in the bathrooms: the bathrooms at the Golf Resort are all marble with separate glass shower and dual-sink, much much nicer.
reviews.title: Great Hotel...

reviews.text: 2. The service was very average, not up to Ritz-Carlton standards. You always had to ask twice to get anything done. This is particularly true for the staff at the pools and beach. At the pool, there was never anyone at the counter where the staff is supposed to greet you and set up the chairs for you. I usually would set up my chair myself since I could not find any staff member to do it for me, only to later have a staff member coming out of nowhere telling me that I should not have set up the chair myself but should have asked someone to do it for me. When I said: "but there was no one there", I received no reply. At the beach, I would have to ask 2 times, the second time in a very insistent tone for the staff member to actually start moving. Once, I said I wanted the last chairs at the end of the beach (b/c it's less crowded) and the staff member complained that it was far away and that he could not walk all the way there and had to drive there. Really, it's not that far away. Overall, I found the staff at the pool and beach to be very lazy. I have stayed at 3 other Ritz Carlton properties in the past (Sarasota, Laguna Niguel and Palm Beach) and the service there was much much better.
reviews.title: This place rocks! Easily a family favourite.

likes.liked: — Great Service and Staff, Beautiful Rooms, Great Location

reviews.text: Overall, I had a good stay b/c of the beach being so nice, but as far as the facilities and service go, the Ritz Naples is just not up to Ritz Carlton standards.
reviews.title: Close to perfect, but. . .

likes.disliked: — Construction Noise, Low Water Pressure in Shower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked using my Amex Platiunum travel. This was excellent, I was upgraded to nice ocean front room, received free breakfast daily and 1 free lunch.
reviews.title: Fabulous, as always

reviews.text: A beautiful hotel on a beautiful beach, but beauty has a price (both financial and sweat equity). We booked a Full Ocean View/King/Non-S 3 months in advance, only to learn two days prior to arrival that we were confirmed for a Double/S. Be sure to not only confirm with central reservations, but with the hotel's front desk as well. The hotel ulitimately resolved the issue (we received a partial ocean view room at a lower rate), however, not without significant effort. Management's intial response was to throw up their arms; Ritz guests should not have to step-in where management fails. Once settled in, we spent 3 lovely days prior to the Memorial Day holiday, however, once the crowds rolled in all was lost again. This Ritz cannot handle full capacity. The hotel, grounds, pool, beach were overrun with children and the hotel just fell apart. Even the spa couldn't keep it together, we cancelled our appointments days in advance and were still charged. Also, be prepared to be nickled and dimed, from beach chairs to coffee. We don't mind paying, but not every turn. We have stayed at several other Ritz hotels both here and abroad, this by far was the worst experience.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Not a Beautiful Stay
Nice but not perfect...
reviews.text: We stayed here 3 nights in April and found the grounds to be very nice and attractive. There are 2 pools, one designated as an adults only pool which sounded fantastic until we found out the hard way that this pool is where children's swimming lessons are held. RIDICULOUS! This was very unfortunate because it became a major distraction for what should have been a relaxing quiet pool day. The other negative was the room which was very small and average, especially for the fortune that it cost. We had an ocean front room which provided a beautiful view however the balconies also provide an an excellent view of all other balconies as well...not private at all. On the positive side, the spa was absolutely phenominal...top notch and very beautifully appointed. I would go back just for the spa. Also the restaurant "The Grill Room" was very nice, food and service were excellent, in fact we went back again the next night. Overall the common areas were pleasant but again the room was definitely a disappointment.

As someone who grew up in the Southwest Florida area, I often return to either Naples, Sanibel Island, or Fort Myers Beach for a quick 3 day weekend of R and R. Just a little advice, be careful when you stay at this resort. I've always noticed that the service is perfect during off peak times, but when the kids are out of school or if it is a holiday weekend, this resort is bursting at the seams and the usual Ritz service is in shambles. Although a little pricey, I would recommend this hotel to anyone for the spa, beach, and the fantastic dining, but remember to go on off peak times.
reviews.title: Be careful when you go
Re-consider this property
reviews.text: Booked spring break and expected a crowd. However, when the hotel knows this, they should plan to accomadate. This property can not handle its own capacity. When I checked out I was asked about our stay, told the clerk is was OK. I paid 750 per night for a noisy club level, no availablity at the pool and poor beach service. Drove up to Sarasota Ritz and enjoyed the rest of our week. $4000 dolllars at the Ritz in Naples is not in our future. To many east coast folks battling for pool chairs & who think their loud impolite kids are cute. Car Valets and room staff were great.
I've been here twice in the past month and the service at this hotel never ceases to amaze me.
reviews.title: Incredible service

reviews.text: We loved our stay at the Ritz Carlton Naples. Rooms were great. We had a partial oceanfront and the room overlooked the courtyard, with views of the ocean. Room was very comfortable, quiet, with nice furnishings. Service was wonderful. I was very impressed by dining options - I think they had total of 7 places to eat! We didn't eat at the very expensive restaurant, but rather used the beachfront option several times, the poolside bar, the lobby tapas type restaurant (it was wonderful!!!), and the casual family type restaurant. And, there were lots and lots of great restaurants close to the Ritz. Yes, it's expensive and the only reason we were there was for a business meeting - but it was a great hotel!
reviews.title: Perfect Stay at Ritz Carlton Naples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ritz Carlton Beach Hotel in Naples is absolutely outstanding!!! The service exceeded our expectations. We stayed 2 nights in March and exchanged our wedding vows in the tea garden. Everything was perfect from start to finish. Splurge on an ocean front room - you can open the patio door at night and fall asleep listening to the crashing waves. Our wedding dinner was at the Grill in the Hotel was outstanding!!! This hotel is PURE LUXURY! Can't wait to return!!!
reviews.title: Absolutely Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this location for 3 days recently and while it was a very beautiful resort, I had some drawbacks about my stay. I figured it would be busy since it was prime springbreak season, but for such a highpriced/5 star hotel, they were way too overbooked and it ended up affecting the quality of my stay. If I am paying almost $2000 for 2 nights at a hotel, I expect to have no problem finding chairs by the pool, a spa that is relaxing and not over crowded with teenagers monopolizing everything,( and making a ton of noise), either no or very little waiting time for a table at breakfast, a gym that has equipment available for use, etc, etc. it even took the parking attendants over 30 minutes to find our car (they were very polite, but still). Again, the hotel is very nice, but if you don't mind staying in a hotel that keeps itself at 100% occupancy and still charges its standard rates, go ahead and book a room at the Ritz Naples! By the way - I have stayed at the Ritz at Lake Oconee,GA, Buckhead, GA, Amelia Island FL, San Francisco, CA, and Washington DC and have always had a very pleasant stay at these locations.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort, but waaaaaay too crowded

reviews.text: The pluses: This is a great beachside hotel. Two pools; family and adult. Tennis courts. Enormous spa, which is lovely but you have to walk outside of the hotel to get to it. Nice shops are hidden on the lower floor. Shuttle service to the golf resort- which has a nice playground for kids and great fire pits for adults...plus the golf!!! As always, excellent staff service and delicious food.
reviews.title: Overall, nice hotel for families, meetings, and spa weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The minuses: the rooms are dated and could use renovation. There isn't much within walking distance (restaurant or shopping), so a car is needed to get off the resort. The golf resort isn't that close (~10-15 minutes away) if you have to go between hotels often.
reviews.title: Not Ritz standard
Great property, first rate experience
reviews.text: Typified a good Ritz property. Great location, service, amenities, food. Pool and beach chairs can go early.

reviews.title: Excellent hotel - great location
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for only 1 night on our way up to Orlando from Miami. I must say that this is the most luxurious and grand hotel i have ever stayed in. The pool area and private area of beach are great and very relaxing. Our room was of a very high standard with an amazing view of the ocean. The only negative was the $27 per day valet parking and no self parking. Thankfully we were only stopping for one night otherwise this would have been an extremely expensive add-on! For the price of a room I would expect there to at least be free self parking.

reviews.title: My Annual Pinnacle Event
reviews.text: The service was impeccable; the room was immaculate! Loved the spacious bath/dressing area. The hotel toiletries even included such things as a lint roller and emery board. Would definitely stay here again!

reviews.title: Beautiful Property Can't wait for our next visit!
reviews.text: This property is beautiful! Service is A+++. We visit naples several times in the winter each year and look forward to staying at the Ritz! The staff goes above and beyond. The club level is to die for! We are counting down the days to our next trip!

reviews.title: a luxurious getaway....in the US!
reviews.text: The service from all staff was impeccable. Housekeeping was lovely. The front desk staff, the restaurants' staff, the musicians and more were all wonderful! They manage to remember your name and treat everyone like they're golden! Their service made my business trip seem like a vacation!

we had never been to naples and decided to go as a last minute 3 day 2 night vacation. we try to book through american express because there are many little "perks".....like food credits.... upgrades...... and the ever popular 4:00 check out.
reviews.title: the only place to stay in naples

reviews.text: we've stayed at ritz properties in the past so we are very familiar with the brand and this one did not disappoint.
reviews.title: A Few Waves from Perfection

likes.liked: — Service..the BEST...Loved the live Lobby music

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had booked 2 "gulf side view" rooms for $309 per night. we were a family of 5. two adults and 3 teenage boys. we were upgraded to gulf front rooms upon check in and while they were a bit......old......they were fine and the view was amazing.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the hotel is "old world" stunning in it's furnishings. we ate breakfast in the terrace room. continental was included in our room rate and it was more than adequate. for an additional $9.00 you can have the full buffet.....in my opinion....not necessary.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Ever Guests Treated Like Gold

reviews.text: we had lunch by the pool once and by the beach another day. both delicious and not "horribly" overpriced.
reviews.title: What a wonderful hotel -- highly recommend

reviews.text: We recently spent 5 nights in the Ritz Carlton, Naples. The hotel was absolutely fantastic and is certainly at a 5 star standard. When we booked the hotel we only went for a street view knowing all rooms would be nice and were really pleased when our room was upgraded to a coastal view.
reviews.title: great hotel but beware of extras

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service in the hotel was excellent there are people to help you with everything even put you towels out on loungers by the pool and it was nice that there was an adult only pool as well as one for families which helped us to relax.
reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So all in all the hotel is fantastic. However i haven't reviewed it as 5 out of 5 because there were a few disappointments. If you have your own car or a rental there is only valet parking available which you have to pay $25 a day for and the lads expected a tip each time. I am quite capable of parking my own car so i was a bit disappointed to find this was really a hidden extra. If you want to go on the beach you have to pay $25 for sun lounger and umbrella rental each day (the lads also expect a tip on top as well) so it made the pool area really busy, that is because the beach is public not a private. We also ate in the hotel a few times although the food is excellent beware at breakfast each time you get an orange juice re-fill it will cost you $4 so i found it a bit naughty that they never ask you if you want a re-fill so when it came on the bill i was shocked.
reviews.title: Almost perfect

reviews.text: So if you find a cheap deal to this hotel just take some extra spending money for the hidden extras. It is still a lovely hotel though.
reviews.title: Better than i expected !!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a wonderful vacation at the Ritz! Everything about it was wonderful. From the minute we were welcomed through the front doors, to the our last goodbyes, we were made to feel very special. Every effort was made by the staff to accomodate us in every way. The lobby, rooms, and grounds of the hotel were very impressive. And we can't say enough about the beach. Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful! It was very private with clean sand, warm water, and comfy chairs. The sunsets were out of this world! Whether watching from your balcony or the beach (we watched from both) they were amazingly colorful and memorable. And now even more so for us since we just got engaged on the beach at sunset! The hotel even arranged for a special turn-down service with a heart made of flower petals on the bed for part of our celebration. It was a vacation of a lifetime to remember always. We will for sure be back!
reviews.title: Did Not Want to Leave!!!

likes.disliked: — couldn't find anything NOT to like

description: Located on the pristine white sands of Southwest Florida’s Gulf Coast, The Ritz-Carlton, Naples is a Five Star, Four Diamond beach resort that appeals to today’s sophisticated traveler with an array of pampering amenities. With stunning views of the Gulf of Mexico, the resort offers a variety of innovative dining experiences, a luxurious, 51,000 square-foot world class spa, two heated pools, a high tech entertainment lounge, an interactive environmental children’s program and a wide selection of beach activities and water sports. Only three miles from the beach resort and accessible by a convenient hotel shuttle, the 295-room Ritz-Carlton Golf Resort is ranked as the #1 golf resort in Florida by Conde Nast Traveler magazine and as one of the 15 best luxury golf resorts in North America by Golf Digest. The golf resort is home to a pair of 18-hole signature Greg Norman golf courses at Tiburon and hosts the annual PGA TOUR Franklin Templeton Shootout.
